fixes.name: Median Sales Price National
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau MEDIAN([Price]) to DAX MEDIAN on the column. Kept the aggregation as a measure and transformed the column reference to the 'TableName'[ColumnName] format.

fixes.name: Median Sales Price % Increase
fixes.dax_expression: ((MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price]) - MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])) / MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])) * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau expression using MEDIAN aggregates into DAX by applying MEDIAN to each referenced column and preserving the arithmetic. This is an aggregate-based calculation, so it is implemented as a measure. All column references were converted to the 'TableName'[ColumnName] format.

fixes.name: County Drill Down
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level Tableau IF [State Set] THEN [COUNTYNAME] END into a DAX IF expression that returns COUNTYNAME when the State Set condition is true, otherwise BLANK(). This operates at the row level, so it is implemented as a calculated column.
